Today, as in the past, a diagnosis of a rabies case is, in a statistical sense (>99.9%), synonymous with fatality. There is no proven treatment once clinical signs appear. This presents a huge dilemma to the clinician faced with a rabies patient, with few options
59 . For a veterinarian, the animal is euthanized. For a physician, the patient may be placed in isolation, and at a minimum palliative care needs to be provided.
